story: Derrick Dearman appeared to be high on drugs in his Alabama prison in the days leading up to his execution.
The convicted killer raged in phone calls and emails, anguishing over how his willingness to die for his crimes wouldn’t change the perception of him as an irredeemable monster.

And by the time he took his final breath, his longtime addiction to methamphetamine — the drug he blamed for fueling the murders of five people, including a pregnant woman, in 2016 — had consumed him to the end.
Dearman, 36, had meth in his body when Alabama put him to death by lethal injection in October 2024, according to a toxicology report confirming what eyewitnesses believed at the time.
He isn’t the only prisoner to be executed with narcotics in their system in Alabama recently.

Since Alabama resumed executions in 2023, following a pause on capital punishment amid a series of failed lethal injection attempts, the state has executed 11 people, including Dearman. An NBC News review of available autopsies shows that at least three others had taken illegal drugs prior to their executions: Jamie Ray Mills, 50, was executed last year with meth in his body, while Carey Dale Grayson, 50, and Kenneth Smith, 58, died last year with a form of a synthetic cannabinoid in their system, according to their toxicology reports. Synthetic cannabinoids imitate the effects of substances like marijuana.
Alabama has its fourth execution of the year scheduled for Thursday.

Jon Ozmint, a former prosecutor who was the director of the South Carolina Department of Corrections from 2003 to 2011, said that the discovery during autopsy of drugs unrelated to an execution and not prescribed to an inmate would have been “a red flag for us.”

“We definitely would have launched an after-action review, and then, if there was any indication of you know, staff wrongdoing, we would have launched the appropriate level of investigation,” Ozmint said.
Mills was executed by lethal injection, and Grayson and Smith died by an execution method using nitrogen gas. (Smith was the first inmate in the nation to die in that manner.)

The amount of the drugs found in Dearman, Mills, Grayson and Smith was relatively small, independent medical experts who reviewed the inmates’ records told NBC News, but their detection still indicates the drugs had been recently absorbed.
D’Michelle DuPre, a forensic consultant in South Carolina and a former medical examiner, has analyzed about 125 death row inmates’ toxicology reports throughout her career, she said.
“I have rarely seen an opioid in the inmates’ tox screen. I don’t recall seeing a narcotic,” DuPre noted.

Charlotte Morrison, a senior attorney with the Equal Justice Initiative, which represented Mills in his death row case, said drugs are generally less of a problem on death row in Alabama’s William C. Holman Correctional Facility because of heightened security and inmates’ isolation.
However, she said, she’s not surprised to learn that even those inmates can score drugs, indicating the depths of the problem.
“The entire system is poorly managed,” Morrison said. Drugs “are a pervasive crisis.”
The Alabama Department of Corrections and the state attorney general’s office did not immediately respond to inquiries about the inmates’ toxicology results.

According to the state’s execution protocol, on the afternoon of an execution, “a medical examination of the condemned inmate will be completed, with the results recorded on a Medical Treatment Record or Body Chart.” The Department of Corrections also did not immediately respond when asked if workers are checking for drug use in that final examination and what happens if it is detected.

In a deposition last October involving Grayson’s case, Corrections Commissioner John Hamm acknowledged drugs are circulating in Alabama’s prisons. He agreed that, in some instances, corrections employees may be smuggling the contraband into the prisons and selling them to prisoners.

In recent months, the Department of Corrections said a corrections officer was accused of the large-scale trafficking of narcotics, including meth and marijuana, at the state prison in St. Clair County. Additionally, visitors have attempted to bring drugs into facilities, including at Holman, or used drones to drop backpacks containing drugs onto prison grounds.

The drug trade has had lethal consequences, as well. Of the 277 deaths last year of inmates in state Department of Corrections custody, 46 were classified as “accidental/overdose,” according to an ACLU of Alabama report.

In 2020, the Justice Department sued Alabama for alleged constitutional violations within its prison system, citing instances of excessive force, sexual abuse and poor sanitary conditions. The suit also mentioned the system’s “failure to prevent the introduction of illegal contraband leads to prisoner-on-prisoner violence.”

“The use of illicit substances, including methamphetamines or fentanyl or synthetic cannabinoids, is prevalent in Alabama’s prison for men,” the complaint alleges. “Prisoners using illicit substances often harm others or become indebted to other prisoners.”
The federal government’s lawsuit against Alabama remains ongoing, and the state has largely denied the allegations in court filings.

Carla Crowder, the executive director of Alabama Appleseed, a nonprofit criminal justice reform organization that provides legal and re-entry services, said prison officials have the ability to root out drugs in prisons “from a public corruption perspective.”
“Start tracking down the source — who’s in charge, who’s calling the shots,” Crowder said. “We are advocating for the state to begin to take this seriously.”

During Commissioner Hamm’s deposition, one of Grayson’s lawyers pointed out the ability for some death row inmates to acquire drugs, including his own client — and questioned whether that affected Grayson’s ability to meaningfully participate in his own defense.

“Mr. Grayson admitted that he was on drugs at the time of his deposition or had taken them in the immediate — in the preceding 12 hours,” lawyer Spencer Hahn told U.S. District Judge R. Austin Huffaker Jr.

“I don’t understand how a person who is being held on single block at the most secure prison in the state of Alabama is allowed to alter his consciousness using drugs before a deposition that is central to his case,” Hahn said. “So a lot of what Mr. Grayson said and may not have said, he was not in his right mind in a lot of ways.”
Hahn added that Grayson had been under the influence of flakka, a synthetic stimulant similar to the more commonly known bath salts.
He said Grayson’s drug use was also consistent with a synthetic cannabinoid found in Smith’s autopsy. An attorney for the state responded that the synthetic cannabinoid Smith consumed was “smoked.”
“Certainly taking drugs is illegal, but so is providing drugs to a prisoner. ”
Said Spencer hahn, a lawyer for a Death row inmate

“Having access to these mind-altering substances can absolutely impact your conscious state and your decision-making,” said David Dadiomov, an assistant professor of clinical pharmacy at the University of Southern California.
Dadiomov also said the way these drugs are used among people who are incarcerated is different because of the setting.

“Things are misused simply based on access,” he said. “At extremely high doses, because these substances are usually very potent, they also cause psychotic-like effects, or effects that are quite different from what people classically view as intoxication from marijuana.”
During Hamm’s deposition, Hahn questioned how Smith could have drugs in his system when he “had been watched for four days straight before an execution.”
“Somehow he was able to, from an isolation cell, obtain flakka or whatever that synthetic cannabinoid source was,” Hahn said of Smith.
“Certainly taking drugs is illegal,” Hahn added, “but so is providing drugs to a prisoner. And somebody got those drugs into that prison.”
During the deposition, the judge suggested drugs could be getting into Alabama prisons another way.

“There has been an issue in the state prison system of lawyers bringing in papers that have been soaked in drugs and then giving them to their clients and DOC, you know, or whatever the facility maybe can’t stop that from happening because it’s legal papers,” Judge Huffaker said. “And then the particular inmate smokes or ingests it or does whatever with it.”
Hahn denied his law office had ever done so.
He declined to comment about Grayson’s case when reached by NBC News this week.
A lawyer for Smith also couldn’t immediately be reached for comment.

Dearman, who initially pleaded not guilty to the crimes, later fired his two court-appointed attorneys and changed his plea to guilty.
In a phone interview with NBC News in April 2024, Dearman said he had dropped the appeals in his case and was ready for the state to execute him on capital murder and kidnapping charges.

Dearman said he was high on meth in 2016 when he burst into a bungalow armed with an ax and firearms in a rural area near Mobile. His estranged ex-girlfriend, Laneta Lester, was staying at the home, which belonged to her brother.

Dearman was convicted of killing five people while they slept: Lester’s brother, Joseph Adam Turner, 26, and his wife, Shannon Melissa Randall, 35; Randall’s brother, Robert Lee Brown, 26; and two others who lived at the home, Justin Kaleb Reed, 23, and his wife, Chelsea Marie Reed, 22, who was five months pregnant. Dearman was also convicted in the death of the Reed’s unborn child.
He told NBC News last year that he was addicted to drugs since he was a teenager and that his dependency on them ignited the rampage.
“Drugs turned me into a very unpredictable, unstable and violent person,” he said. “That’s not who I am. The person that committed these crimes and the person who I truly am is two different people.”
Dadiomov said there is a strong correlation between long-term meth use and severe mental illness, likening meth-induced psychosis to schizophrenia.
“They present similarly,” he said. “They can have the similar features of hallucinations, so seeing things that aren’t there or hearing things that aren’t there.”

Morrison, who represented Mills on Alabama’s death row, said the need for inmates to turn to drugs in prison, and then potentially gain access to narcotics from corrections officers and other employees, only shows the absence of rehabilitation and programming to help prisoners — even those relegated to death row.
“It impacts any sense of hope,” Morrison said. “It’s a system that reflects to an entire group of people that they do not have worth.”

title: Chinese studio criticized for using AI to make gay couple straight in body horror film
summary: A U.S. film distributor has criticized a Chinese studio for reportedly using artificial intelligence to turn a gay couple straight when distributing the body horror movie “Together” in China.
story: HONG KONG — A U.S. film distributor has criticized a Chinese studio for reportedly using artificial intelligence to make a gay couple straight when distributing the body horror film “Together” in China.

Early this month, moviegoers who attended preview screenings said on Chinese social media that one of two men shown getting married in the film was digitally altered into a woman, most likely with AI.

Neon, the film’s global distributor, said Wednesday that it “does not approve of” the “unauthorized” edit of the film by Chengdu-based film distributor Hishow and that screenings of the altered version must be stopped, Deadline reported.

Written and directed by Australian filmmaker Michael Shanks, the movie tells the story of a couple, played by American actors Alison Brie and Dave Franco, who move to the countryside to save their relationship and encounter a mysterious force that draws them closer.
Hishow offered the first pre-release screenings in 11 Chinese cities starting Sept. 12, with the movie scheduled to be released nationwide on Sept. 19.
Many early viewers took to social media to complain about the gender change.
One user on Xiaohongshu, or RedNote, a Chinese platform similar to Instagram, described the AI alteration of the same-sex wedding as “outrageous.”

“The version shown in mainland China didn’t delete this scene. Instead, it photoshopped a woman’s face over one of the men,” the person posted. “It looked quite reasonable. Even the American conservatives would be impressed!”
The state-owned China Film Group Corporation said last week that the wide release of “Together” had been postponed due to “a change in the film’s distribution plan,” without offering further details.
“The specific new date will be announced once it is confirmed,” it said.
NBC News has reached out to Hishow and Neon for comment.

Though imported films are often edited by Chinese censors to cut scenes deemed too sensitive or risqué, this appears to be among the first instances of technology being used to change a scene instead.

One of the biggest subjects of censorship is homosexuality, which despite being decriminalized in China has been the target of a government crackdown in recent years, even though surveys shows the public is increasingly supportive of LGBTQ people.

In 2021, Chinese authorities banned “effeminate” behavior from screens, and fans complained in 2022 when they noticed the removal of an LGBTQ storyline from the TV sitcom “Friends,” which is highly popular in China. At least 10 scenes with gay references were also dropped from the Chinese version of the 2018 biopic “Bohemian Rhapsody,” about the rock musician and Queen frontman Freddie Mercury.

The alteration of the “Together” wedding scene “signifies that the government has a clear stance, and they have a red line,” Jason Coe, who teaches courses on film and media studies at the University of Hong Kong, told NBC News. “They will look to enforce it, and they will find innovative ways to enforce it.”

Zeng Hong, an assistant professor at Hong Kong Baptist University’s Academy of Film, agreed that the apparent use of AI in “Together” is not “looking promising for LGBTQ rights as well as their representation on Chinese screens.”
This isn’t the first time that artificial intelligence has been used to alter a film in Asia.

Early last month, the 2013 hit Bollywood romantic drama “Raanjhanaa” was re-released in India with its ending altered by AI in what is believed to be a world first, setting off a debate about the future of storytelling in the country and beyond.

The original version of the film ends with the death of a Hindu man who has a doomed romance with a Muslim woman. In the new version he lives, in what production house Eros International said was a “creative reinterpretation.”
The film’s director, Aanand L. Rai, who was unaware of the changes, called the decision “deeply disrespectful.”
“To cloak a film’s emotional legacy in a synthetic cape without consent, is not a creative act,” Rai wrote in a post on Instagram. “It’s an abject betrayal of everything we built.”

title: ‘Law & Order’ Returns for Its 25th Season: How to Watch the Premiere
summary: How to watch the Season 25 premiere of "Law & Order," starring Tony Goldwyn, Hugh Dancy, Odelya Halevi, Maura Tierney and Reid Scott.
story: The 2025-26 TV season is in full swing. And while Benjamin Franklin famously said the only things for certain in life are death and taxes, he spoke long before the invention of TV, so he’d have to amend his declaration to include “Law & Order” being on the small screen. Yes, the venerable NBC procedural is gearing up for its 25th season — that's 500 episodes and counting, if you're keeping track.

The 24th season ended on a cliffhanger: The man who appeared to have killed the sister of Assistant District Attorney Samantha Maroun (played by Odelya Halevi), as well as another person, was gunned down in the street after he was acquitted. The episode wrapped up leaving viewers wondering who shot him.

The whole harrowing ordeal started after a model was found dead and Detectives Vincent Riley (Reid Scott) and Jalen Shaw (Mehcad Brooks) investigated the matter before Lt. Jessica Brady (Maura Tierney) learned the DNA on the model’s body was connected to the murder of Maroun’s sister 12 years earlier. That murder was never solved and eventually became a cold case.
While viewers wait to see just what happened, they will do so without a key cast member. Brooks is leaving the show after three seasons.
When Does ‘Law & Order’ Return in 2025?

“Law & Order” will kick off its 25th season with a one-hour episode Sept. 25 at 8 p.m. ET. It will be followed by the Season 27 premiere of “Law & Order: Special Victims Unit” at 9 p.m. ET and the first episode from Season 5 “Law & Order: Organized Crime,” which moved from NBC to Peacock, at 10 p.m. ET.
Where Can I Watch ‘Law & Order’?
The premiere will air on NBC. It will also stream the next day on Peacock.
(Peacock is part of our parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: 'Law & Order: SVU' Is Back! How to Watch the Season 27 Premiere
summary: "Law & Order: SVU" returns for its 27th season on Sept. 25 with Mariska Hargitay, Ice-T, Kelli Giddish, Kevin Kane and Aimé Donna Kelly. Here's where to watch.
story: The dedicated detectives from "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit" are back on the case for Season 27.

Mariska Hargitay returns as Capt. Olivia Benson, the longest-running character in prime-time live-action show history, and Ice-T continues his record-setting run as Detective Fin Tutuola in the latest season of the NBC police drama, with a few bumps and bruises.

“We have so much fun, and I am so deeply invested, and I really look at it as a team,” Hargitay told “Access” ahead of Season 27. “That’s how I lead, I think, by keeping the team together and the team focused.”
Here's what to know.
When Does 'Law & Order: SVU' Return in 2025?
The 27th season kicks off at 9 p.m. ET on Sept. 25.
New episodes will air on Thursdays at 9 p.m. on NBC and stream on Peacock the following day.
(Peacock is part of our parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Where Can You Watch the Season 27 'Law & Order: SVU' Premiere?
The season premiere will air on NBC at 9 p.m. ET on Sept. 25 and then will be available to stream on Peacock on Sept. 26.
What Other 'SVU' Cast Members Are Back?

In addition to Hargitay and Ice-T, Peter Scanavino returns as Assistant District Attorney Sonny Carisi, Kevin Kane is back as Detective Terry Bruno and Kelli Giddish is now once again a series regular as Amanda Rollins.
Giddish left the show in 2022, returned for multiple guest appearances and then was announced in May as a series regular again.
Aimé Donna Kelly is also back as Capt. Renee Curry.

“It just felt so natural,” Curry told TODAY.com about being on the show. “And as an actor, speaking personally, getting to work with Mariska and learn from her, I think you’re seeing kind of a reflection of that in these two characters. Like, Curry learned so much from Benson, and me, Aimé, I’m learning so much from Mariska. So, it just translates really well on screen, I think — I hope.”

Octavio Pisano, who plays Detective Joe Velasco, is expected to appear in the Season 27 premiere, according to a July report by Deadline. However, it was announced in May that Pisano and Juliana Aidén Martinez were leaving “Law & Order: SVU” after Season 26.

title: Who Won 'America's Got Talent' 2025?
summary: Who won America's Got Talent the 2025 competition? Here are the finalists and who won.
story: A winner for Season 20 of "America's Got Talent" has officially been crowned.
After two days of fan favorites and Golden Buzzer winners holding their breath to see who would take home the $1 million prize, only one came out victorious.
The two-part finale kicked off on Tuesday, Sept. 23, before the 10 finalists vied for the title and the seven-figure prize, giving their all in their final performance during the Sept. 24 finale.
The stakes were high as the finalists performed alongside past acts and special guests before the winner of Season 20 was revealed.
Who Won 'AGT' 2025?
Jessica Sanchez

This is Sanchez’s second stint competing on “AGT,” but her first as an adult. The singer performed as a child on Season 1 of the show and has now returned to wow the judges while pregnant with her first child.
She performed the Bruno Mars and Lady Gaga hit “Die With a Smile” in the Sept. 23 episode. Sanchez reached the finals thanks to a Golden Buzzer from judge Sofía Vergara during Sanchez’s audition.
Who Else Made the Top 5?
2nd Place: Chris Turner

The improv rapper spits freestyle rhymes on the fly after taking suggestions from the judges, showing off his ability to create an original song off the cuff about everything from mushy peas to plums. He advanced to the finals via the fan vote.
3rd Place: Jourdan Blue

A New Orleans singer and street performer with a moving personal story of perseverance motivated by his girlfriend and young son, Blue also endured an illness in the quarterfinals to reach the final round.
He was voted into the finals by the fans.
4th Place: Leo High School Choir
The choir from Leo High School in the South Side of Chicago, led by LaDonna Hill, has energized fans with its a cappella performances and infectious passion.
The fans voted the choir into the finals.
5th Place: LightWire

A Brazilian group of nearly 20 performers, LightWire has dazzled the crowd with its light-up LED costumes and dance choreography that often has a deeper meaning. Their performances have referenced the rainforest in their native Brazil, carnivale and more.
They reached the final round thanks to Simon Cowell giving them the first Golden Buzzer of the season.
Who Else Competed in the Finale?
Micah Palace

The energetic rapper and TikTok creator from Connecticut delivers his verses in Spanish and English and has become known for his energy and acrobatics onstage. Judge Simon Cowell gave him a Live Golden Buzzer to help him reach the finals.
Mama Duke

The 37-year-old YMCA counselor and rapper from Austin, Texas, went straight to the finals as a result of a Live Golden Buzzer from judge Mel B., thanks to Mama Duke's original raps and colorful outfits.
Sirca Marea
The acrobatic aerial act comprised of a husband-and-wife duo from Barcelona performs breathtaking flips and showstopping moves on a trapeze.
They reached the final thanks to fan voting.
Steve Ray Ladson
The singer and banjo player from South Carolina calls his style "Blackgrass Brothercana."
His performance of his song "Boots Like Mine" in the quarterfinals  earned him a Golden Buzzer from Sofía Vergara, sendinf him straight to the finals.
Team Recycled
The dance team with dazzling visuals reached the finals thanks to judge Howie Mandel giving them his Live Golden Buzzer.

title: Matthew McConaughey Shares His No. 1 Bedroom Tip For Parents
summary: Forget date nights or love languages — Matthew McConaughey says the secret to a lasting marriage is all about the size of your bed
story: Forget date nights or love languages — Matthew McConaughey says the secret to a lasting marriage is all about the size of your bed.
In the actor's newest book, "Poems & Prayers," McConaughey writes, "One way to surely / get ahead. / Is get rid of that / king-Size mattress. / And Sleep in / a Queen-Size Bed."
In a Sept. 22 interview on "The View," McConaughey explained exactly why sleeping in a queen-size bed is so important.

The father of three shared that after getting the idea from a friend, he and his wife, Camila Alves, slept with two king-sized beds pushed together upon having kids so that little ones could sleep in the bed, too.
He explained, however, that when he would wake up in the morning, his wife was "20 feet" away.
"Not productive for snuggling," McConaughey said.
McConaughey has been married to Alves since 2012. The pair share three children: Levi, 17, Vida, 15, and Livingston, 12.
"Drop down to a queen-size bed, it’s good for your marriage," he concluded.

"Poems & Prayers," McConaughey's first book of poems, hit shelves on Sept. 16. The book is a collection of McConaughey's poems, covering topics ranging from his New York Times bestselling memoir "Greenlights" to tips on navigating faith.
While appearing on TODAY Sept. 16, McConaughey shared his motivations for releasing the book, one he says he's been working on since he first began writing poetry at age 18.

"I found myself getting a bit cynical, having a bit of doubt," McConaughey told Craig Melvin. "I am seeing a lot of reasons not to believe, not finding enough things to believe in. So instead of looking at the evidence, of the facts of the world, I thought, 'let's look at ideals, poetry, prayers,' and see if we can maintain the faith in those and bring those down and make those a reality."

title: Millie Bobby Brown to Play Olympian Kerri Strug in New Film: Report
summary: Millie Bobby Brown is reportedly taking on an Olympic role as gymnast Kerri Strug for her next project.
story: Millie Bobby Brown is taking on an Olympic role for her next project.

The actor is in final negotiations to portray Olympic gold medalist Kerri Strug in a new film titled “Perfect,” directed by Gia Coppola and written by Ronnie Sandahl, TODAY.com confirms. 30WEST is executive producing.
Deadline, who first reported the news Sept. 24, notes that while the deal isn't closed, the biopic could be headed to Netflix, with plans to start filming in the spring.

An 18-year-old Strug was a member of the 1996 women's gymnastics team, known as the Magnificent Seven. What makes the athlete's story so inspiring is, as Team USA was attempting to secure the gold medal over Russia and Romania, Strug landed poorly after doing the vault and injured her left ankle.
However, she proceeded to compete in the final vault, sticking the landing with one slight hop, per the Olympics' website, scoring a 9.712.
Even if Strug hadn't competed in the final vault, the US would have still won the gold medal, Olympics.com notes. However, Strug's efforts were celebrated and applauded.
This isn't the first time talks about "Perfect" have been reported. Back in 2020, Olivia Wilde was attached to direct. At the time, Wilde called Sandahl’s script the “best” she’s ever read, on X.
Strug reposted Wilde’s tweet, adding, “I’m beyond grateful it is in your hands!”
Strug has yet to speak out on the reported casting.
The Arizona native first competed in the 1992 Olympics at the Barcelona Games. She was 14 years old when she took home the bronze medal in the team all-around.

Among her other accolades include winning two silver medals and one bronze at the World Championships. She retired from gymnastics after the 1996 Olympics following her history-making moment. She went on to graduate from college and taught second grade in San Jose, California, before working with the U.S. Justice Department’s Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention, according to the Dayton Daily News.
In 2023, Strug reflected on her pivotal 1996 Olympics moment, telling the Dayton Daily News, “I just couldn’t walk away.”

Continuing, “If I hadn’t gone for that last vault, it always would have haunted me. It’s fortunate I came through at that moment. I’m very proud that I was able to accomplish such a big thing at such a young age.”
Some, including Simone Biles, have criticized the coach's decision to push Strug to compete.

“Watching that video — total badass. You go, girl,” Biles said in her Netflix documentary “Simone Biles Rising” while reflecting on her withdrawal at the Tokyo Games. “And I know some of us have even competed on injuries, but I definitely think about it a little differently.”

Strug’s former Olympic gymnastics teammate Dominique Dawes also shared her opinion in the documentary, saying, “I think the Kerri Strug moment, people started to look at it, and they were like, ‘Is that too much on a young child?’
“I think if we look back now we’re like, ‘That was not right,’” Dawes said.

title: Rihanna Has a Daughter! Singer Welcomes Baby Girl With A$AP Rocky
summary: Rihanna and A$AP Rocky welcome third child, she announced on Instagram.
story: Rihanna and A$AP Rocky got their girl!

Rihanna announced on Sept. 24 that they have welcomed their third child, a daughter. She shared a photo of herself cradling her newborn, who is wearing a pink outfit and appears to be fast asleep. The singer shared her baby girl’s name and birthday in the caption.
“Rocki Irish Mayers,” she wrote on Instagram, adding, “Sept 13 2025.”
The second photo in the slideshow shows tiny pink boxing gloves.
Read on to find out what we know about their daughter.
The Singer Has Spoken About Wanting a Girl
In a 2024 profile for Interview Magazine, Rihanna offered a look into her readiness to grow her family with A$AP Rocky, whom she described as a "great dad."
“I don’t know what God wants, but I would go for more than two,” Rihanna explained at the time. “I would try for my girl. But of course, if it’s another boy, it’s another boy.”
The Baby Is Already a Star

Rihanna revealed her latest pregnancy at the 2025 Met Gala. Dressed in line with the evening's theme, “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style,” the singer wore a gray corseted top, long skirt, a crossover necktie and a cropped jacket that showed off her pregnancy bump.
While speaking with TODAY’s Al Roker on the red carpet, she talked about her look for the night, saying, “I brought the kid!” when asked about her accessories.
Meet the Baby's Big Brothers, RZA and Riot
The 37-year-old singer shares two sons with A$AP Rocky.
RZA, named after the Wu-Tang Clan rapper Robert Fitzgerald Diggs, was born in May 2022. In a February 2025 interview with Harper's Bazaar, Rihanna offered a glimpse of her son's strong personality.
“RZA is just an empath,” Rihanna said. “He’s so magical. He loves music. He loves melody. He loves books. He loves water. Bath time, swimming, pool, beach, anything.”

Riot Rose was born in August 2023. His name was inspired by a song that A$AP Rocky collaborated on with singer Pharrell Williams. Titled "Riot," the song came out in 2023 and famously sparked speculation as the lyrics describe Rihanna as his wife.
RZA and Riot Posed on the Red Carpet With Their Pregnant Mom

In July 2025, RZA and Riot made a rare public appearance with their mother and father while attending the "Smurfs" premiere. Rihanna, who voiced Smurfette in the film, appeared visibly pregnant with RZA and Riot at her side. The two boys were top of the singer's mind as they prepared to head into the theater.

“I cannot wait for them to see the movie,” Rihanna said in an interview with ET. “That’s going to be my favorite, favorite part, when they recognize it as my voice ... I can’t wait to see what that reaction is going to be like.”
“I want some cool points," Rihanna explained. "If I don’t walk away with cool points tonight, we’ve got to start over.”
The singer also told ET that she already knew the sex of her baby.
“A few people know,” she explained, adding that she didn’t find out with an over-the-top gender reveal. “Nothing spectacular, no production.”

title: Meet the Castaways of ‘Survivor’ Season 49
summary: A new batch of contestants have signed up to be stranded on the beaches of Fiji, where they’ll try to outwit, outlast and outplay on “Survivor” 49.
story: A new batch of contestants have signed up to be stranded on the beaches of Fiji, where they’ll try to outwit, outlast and outplay on “Survivor” 49.

The new season of the CBS competition show arrives Wednesday, Sept. 24, at 8 p.m. ET/PT, with a special two-hour premiere. The first episode will introduce fans to the 18 castaways competing this season.

Among the group, which includes a correctional officer, film producer and rocket scientist, are two players who will return for the show’s milestone 50th season, premiering in spring 2026. The network has already announced 22 members of the all-returnees cast and will later reveal the two additional contestants from “Survivor” 49 that were asked to play again.
Before the highly-anticipated Season 50, fans will see a group of newbies form alliances, fight for immunity and vote each other out at Tribal Council.
Ahead of “Survivor’s” return, host Jeff Probst spoke to The Hollywood Reporter about why the Season 49 castaways stand out.

“Every time a new group comes in, they find a different way to do something with the Shot in the Dark, or they encounter a new take on the Beware Advantage,” he said, referring to twists that have been added in the “new era” of “Survivor.” “Anytime something like that happens, it now gifts the game because new things are possible or new things are plausible, even if they haven’t happened yet.”

Probst continued, “When Rizo and Shannon and Savannah and Jawan and Kristina all get out there this season, they have their own take on the game, but they’re also bringing 48 seasons of history of what has worked, what hasn’t worked, what they should encounter, what they should expect to encounter. That’s what makes it unique — that they’re playing with more history than the previous group had and therefore, maybe it’s a slightly more evolved group every time.”
He also teased that loyalty during the second half of the season is like “a temporary tattoo,” hinting the gameplay will be ruthless.
CBS announced that following the premiere, which will air on the network and also stream on Paramount+, the rest of the season will have 90-minute weekly episodes starting Oct. 1.
So, who is hoping to leave Fiji with a $1 million check and the title of Sole Survivor? Get to know the castaways of “Survivor” 49, below.
The Cast of ‘Survivor’ 49
Alex Moore
Age: 27
Hometown: Evanston, Illinois
Current city: Washington, D.C.
Job: Political comms director
Kimberly ‘Annie’ Davis
Age: 49
Hometown: Portland, Oregon

title: Jessica Chastain Says She's ‘Not Aligned’ on Apple’s Decision to Postpone ‘The Savant.’ Here's Why
summary: Jessica Chastain responded to Apple's decision to postpone the show "The Savant." Here's why the show was postponed and what Apple and Chastain has said.
story: Jessica Chastain is speaking out about Apple's decision to postpone the Sept. 26 premiere of the new AppleTV+ thriller series “The Savant," which she stars in.

The Oscar winner, 48, shared a statement Sept. 24 on her official Instagram account. In it, she says she wasn't "aligned" with the company's move to delay the first two episodes of the series, which tells the story of an undercover investigator, played by Chastain, who infiltrates online hate groups in an effort to prevent domestic attacks.

"I want to say how much I value my partnership with Apple. They’ve been incredible collaborators and I deeply respect their team," Chastain began her statement. "That said, I wanted to reach out and let you know that we’re not aligned on the decision to pause the release of 'The Savant."
Chastain went on to say during the five years she's been working behind the scenes on the show, "we’ve seen an unfortunate amount of violence in the United States."

She cited several events to support her statement, including the attempted kidnapping of Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, the Jan. 6, 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol, the two assassination attempts on President Donald Trump, the assassination of  Democratic lawmaker Melissa Hortman (who was killed along with her husband and dog) and the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk on Sept. 10.
"I’ve never shied away from difficult subjects, and while I wish this show wasn’t so relevant, unfortunately it is," Chastain wrote.

Chastain concluded her by statement by saying "The Savant" is about "the heroes who work every day to stop violence before it happens," adding that "honoring their courage feels more urgent than ever."
"While I respect Apple’s decision to pause the release for now, I remain hopeful the show will reach audiences soon," she wrote.
On Sept. 23, Apple announced it would be postponing the premiere of "The Savant" in a brief statement to Variety.

“After careful consideration, we have made the decision to postpone ‘The Savant,’” the company's statement read. “We appreciate your understanding and look forward to releasing the series at a future date.”
TODAY.com has reached out to Apple for additional comment.

title: ‘Golden Bachelor’ Season 2: Meet the 23 Women on Mel Owens' Season
summary: Who is in the Golden Bachelor cast? See the 23 women chosen for Mel Owens season 2 of The Golden Bachelor.
story: Two years after “The Golden Bachelor” became a phenomenon, the spin-off will return for Season 2.
With a second season, which premieres Wednesday, Sept. 24, at 8 p.m. ET on ABC, comes a new lead, Mel Owens, and 23 women hoping to receive a rose from the former professional football player.

Ahead of the two-hour premiere, ABC released the official cast for Season 2. The network also posted a video that shows each woman sharing fun facts about herself and explaining why she signed up for the show.
One contestant named Nicolle, a 64-year-old yoga instructor from Miami Beach, Florida, says in the clip about the “Golden” ladies, “I think we’re more beautiful, sexy, vibrant than ever.”

“The Golden Bachelor” debuted in 2023 with Gerry Turner as the first lead. The newest addition to the Bachelor Nation franchise takes the same familiar format but instead follows contestants in their golden years on their journey to find love. The ages of Mel’s contestants range from 58 to 77.

Mel, a 66-year-old retired NFL player who now works as a lawyer, was announced as the season’s leading man in April. He's since then sparked controversy after he said he wasn’t interested in dating women his own age.

“They asked me, ‘What’s your preferences?’ So I just said, ‘45 to 60,’ just being honest,” he said on the University of Michigan Athletics’ podcast, “In the Trenches,” in June. “And then the process went and I was selected and then we had lunch with the executive producer. I said, ‘You know, if they’re 60 or over, I’m cutting them.’”
He also said, “They got to be fit because I’m staying in shape and work out and stuff. And I told them, ‘Try to stay away from the artificial hips and the wigs.’”
He later revealed in an interview with Glamour that he apologized to the contestants for his remarks during the first night of filming.

“I apologized to the women on the show. When I first walked in, I addressed it. I apologized to them. I said, ‘It was unfair, insensitive. I want to earn it back. Just give me the chance.’ And hopefully, these last two weeks I earned some of that back,’” said Owens, who was in the middle of filming at the time.

How will they react? Viewers will see how the cast responds during the premiere. For now, meet the 23 cast members of "The Golden Bachelor" Season 2 and learn what they revealed about themselves in the introduction video and in their official bios. Then, check back here every week to see who is still in the running to secure Mel’s final rose.

title: Kimberly J. Brown Talks Starring in Halloween Film with Her 'Halloweentown' Co-Star and Husband
summary: Kimberly J. Brown and her former "Halloweentown" co-star and husband, Daniel Kountz, are starring in a highly anticipated movie sequel this Halloween season — but not the one you might be expecting
story: Kimberly J. Brown and her former "Halloweentown" co-star and husband, Daniel Kountz, are starring in a highly anticipated movie sequel this Halloween season — but not the one you might be expecting.

The actors and real-life spouses first worked together in the 2001 Disney film “Halloweentown II: Kalabar’s Revenge.” Over two decades later, they're teaming up once again for another Halloween movie but this time, with the Hallmark Channel.

Out on Oct. 11, “Haul Out the Halloween" is the third installment in the “Haul Out the Holly” series, which is centered around the residents of Evergreen Lane, a neighborhood homeowner association that pulls out all the stops to decorate for Christmas.
When Brown and Kountz's characters, Luna and Marvin, move to the block, their neighbors aren't sure what to think when they see their extravagant Halloween decoration display.

“We really enjoyed getting to play a different side of the Halloween excitement. We’ve been on the magical, witchy and warlock side before, and it was fun to play some characters that are Shakespeare buffs and into the history and the spookiness of Halloween,” Brown tells TODAY.com over a video call.
“It couldn’t have checked off any more boxes of a dream scenario,” Brown says of her role in the film.
In the holiday flick, Luna and Marvin's neighbors agree to give Halloween the attention it deserves. Along the way, they work together to plan a Halloween charity fundraiser.

Brown says she and her husband were already fans of the “Haul Out the Holly” series before signing on for the movie, as she's been best friends with one of the film's stars, Lacey Chabert, since childhood.

“I’m a proud bestie. I try to support wherever I can and watch whatever I can. (Daniel and I) had actually decorated our Christmas tree to the 'Haul Out the Holly' premiere the year (it) first premiered and enjoyed it and laughed and loved the cast," she says.
When Chabert told Brown another film was in development and she wanted her to be involved, the "Halloweentown" star felt "giddy" and started "slightly fangirling."
“Getting to be a part of that world was truly just very exciting for us because we had been fans since the beginning,” she says.
Brown calls the experience of working with Chabert “the absolute best.”

“In one of our first scenes, standing across Lacey and next to Daniel, I had this kind of pinch me moment. What a dream (and) blessing of a job to be able to act across my best friend and then act next to my husband. And we all got to do it together and laugh and have fun," she says.
Brown says fans can expect a mix of “spookiness,” “laughter” and “festive magic” in the film, plus some epic Halloween sweaters.

“For Halloween being such a spooky holiday, it’s equally as balanced with so much laughter in this movie,” Brown describes, adding that she and Kountz would be “excited” to return for any potential sequels to the film series.
The 'Halloweentown' Legacy

Brown and Kountz starred together in "Halloweentown II" but they didn't connect on a romantic level until over a decade later, when she reached out to her former co-star to take part in some sketches she was filming for her YouTube channel. The rest is history.

Brown says they still honor their "Halloweentown" legacy by regularly taking part in fan events, especially around Halloween. Naturally, fans are always curious to know if she'd be open to doing more "Halloweentown" sequels in the future.

“I am totally down to do another one. Disney knows I’m down to do another one, so the ball’s in their court. The fans pitch me storylines and all kinds of things. So yes, we would all love to get back together and do another one,” she says.
It's been nearly 27 years since the first "Halloweentown" movie was released. When asked why she thinks the fanbase is still going strong, Brown notes that the Cromwell family is "very relatable."

"When I was filming the first 'Halloweentown,' I was 13, and I was also trying to figure out who I was, just like Marnie was," she says. "It’s been such an honor to watch the movies grow over the years. We were just supposed to do one movie back in the day, and because of the incredible fans and and how they’ve put so much love into it over the years, we got to do sequels and and now they’re on Disney+."

Brown, who also starred in the franchise's second and third films, says the success of "Halloweentown" is beyond their "wildest dreams." She added that she's "touched" to know people "still share their Halloween with the movies."
Brown's Own Halloween Traditions
It's no secret that Brown's real-life love for Halloween runs deep.
While Brown’s Halloween display isn’t quite as grand as her character in “Haul Out the Halloween,” she’s certainly got some decorating skills of her own, as seen on her Instagram.
Brown says she looks forward to putting up a Halloween tree for the first time this year.
In addition to decorating for the spooky season, Brown says she and Kountz also enjoy planning family costumes with their dog, Luna, and usually start mulling over ideas mid-summer.
“Luna has pretty much become aware that most Halloweens she’s gonna have to try on multiple costumes, but I think she digs it,” she teases.

As far as other Halloween traditions go, Brown is "team candy corn" and loves to light pumpkin spice candles in her house. She prefers "family-friendly" Halloween flicks over horror films and loves carving both real and craft pumpkins.
Halloween is one of Brown's favorite holidays, but she's also a fan of Christmas, calling the two celebrations "equally magical." Still, she admits that Halloween has a leg up due to the costumes.
“There’s no shock as to why I’ve been an actress my whole life because you get to become different characters on Halloween,” she says.
As she looks ahead to the premiere of "Haul Out the Halloween," Brown is thrilled to be experiencing her favorite time of the year and tap into her inner child for the next few weeks.
"The wonder, the joy of Halloween, the excitement, the magic, it's all there and it's my favorite aspect of the season to still grab on to as much as possible," she says.

title: Alyssa Milano Says Goodbye to Her Breast Implants: ‘There Is Joy in Letting Go’
summary: Alyssa Milano is opening up about the powerful emotions she's experiencing as she undergoes a procedure to remove her breast implants
story: Alyssa Milano is opening up about the powerful emotions she's experiencing as she undergoes a procedure to remove her breast implants.

The former "Charmed" star, 52, posted a photo of herself dressed in a hospital gown and cap Sept. 24 on Instagram. In her caption, she shared her excitement about "letting go" of her breast implants, which, she said, will make her feel "free."

"Today I’m releasing those false narratives, the parts of me that were never actually parts of me," she wrote. "I’m letting go of the body that was sexualized, that were abused, that I believed was necessary for me to be attractive; to be loved; to be successful; to be happy."
Milano went on to say she hoped her decision to remove her implants would be a step toward "releasing" her daughter Bella "from ever feeling those same unhealthy demands" about her own body.
Milano acknowledged that some women, like "RuPaul's Drag Race" judge Michelle Visage, "find freedom and beauty in choosing their implants."

"What is a false narrative for me may be the exact right thing for them, and I am so happy that we can all find our femininity and peace on our own terms," she wrote, adding that she was "tremendously inspired" by women who “have been open and public about their relationships with their breast implants, making it easier for me and countless others to find our own way.”

“Today I am loved, I am feminine, I am attractive, and I am successful. None of that is because of my implants,” she wrote. “I will still be all of those things when I wake up and they are gone. There is so much and joy in that knowledge and freedom in the letting go of what was never me in the first place. Today, I’m my authentic self. Today, I’m free.”
Some of Milano’s famous friends, including Visage, commented to  show their support.
“I’M THRILLED FOR YOU! The heal is real baby! See you on the lighter side,” Visage wrote, adding a heart emoji.
“Heal quickly beautiful girl,” wrote actor Meredith Salenger.
Meanwhile, fans commented to thank Milano for her candor.
“Just had my explant yesterday. I really needed to hear this. Thank you,” one fan wrote while another added, “You are an example of bravery, awareness, and authenticity.”

title: Who Is the 'Golden Bachelor'? All About Mel Owens — and Why He Caused Controversy
summary: Who is Mel Owens? About his kids, ex wife, age and controversial comments about dating women who are his age or older.
story: There’s a new Golden Bachelor in town.
Earlier this year, ABC revealed the new leading man looking for love in Season 2 of “The Golden Bachelor” and his name is Mel Owens.

The senior citizen version of “The Bachelor” was originally announced in 2020, with viewers witnessing then-72-year-old Gerry Turner making history as the first star of the spinoff in 2023. Turner went on to marry and later divorce Theresa Nist.
Now, the franchise continues once more with Owens, who is “66 and single — for now,” according to the show’s Instagram page.
With Season 2 set to premiere Sept. 24 at 8 p.m. ET/PT and 7 p.m. CT on ABC, we’re sharing everything you need to know about the new Bachelor Nation star.
He’s an NFL Pro-Turned-Lawyer
Owens was born and raised in Detroit to a close-knit family. His father, Walter Owens, played professional baseball as a member of the Detroit Stars of the Negro American League, per USA Today.
At a young age, Owens followed in his father’s footsteps and his athleticism shone through, according to his ABC bio.
Owens graduated from the University of Michigan and was selected as the ninth overall pick in the 1981 NFL Draft by the LA Rams.

After Owens retired in 1991 following an injury, the former linebacker “transitioned into a career in law and moved to Orange County, California, dedicating himself to helping others — particularly those seeking justice for sports-related injuries,” his bio reads.
He’s a Father of 2
Owens has two sons — Lucas, 20, and Andre, 18 — from a former marriage. After separating from his wife, Owens delayed dating once again to focus on fatherhood.
“I was taking care of my boys,” he told Entertainment Weekly. “They needed all my attention, and I was working (as a lawyer). I just didn’t have time (to date).”
These days, Owens’ sons live “primarily” with him, as he told USA Today.
“I cherish that great father-son relationship,” he said. “Every morning I get to be with them before they go to school.”
In a promotional video for “The Golden Bachelor,” Owens’ son Lucas said he thought starring on the show as a “good opportunity” for his father to “put yourself out there.”
What He's Looking for in a Partner

Now that he’s ready to find love, Owens is taking a chance to “rediscover a love rooted in the simple joys of companionship — sharing life’s everyday moments, making plans for the future, and growing stronger together as a couple,” per his bio.
The lawyer is eager to meet someone who shares that same mission and settled down in his golden years.
In an interview with Entertainment Weekly, Owens said he simply wants to find someone he can “enjoy life with.”
“Whatever comes from that, it comes from that. I had an open heart and an open mind, and without spoiling anything, it’s going to be good,” he said.
While chatting with USA Today, Owens said he’s a “romantic” and reflected on his ideal dates.

“I like to travel, that can be a perfect date,” he said. “Then there’s just being at home, relaxing, maybe watching TV or reading or doing nothing. There are a lot of perfect moments. It’s what mood that strikes.”
He's Been Married Before
Owens was previously married to Fabiana Pimental, who filed for divorce in 2020. The divorce was finalized in 2024.

In an interview with USA Today, the new Golden Bachelor offered insight into the end of their relationship, saying, “It was a long marriage, and it just didn’t work out. I still wish her well. And I love being married.”
Why He Caused Controversy
In June, Owens appeared on the University of Michigan Athletics’ podcast “In the Trenches.” During the discussion, he raised eyebrows when he said he didn’t want to date someone his own age.

“They asked me, ‘What’s your preferences?’ So I just said, ‘45 to 60,’ just being honest,” he said. “And then the process went and I was selected and then we had lunch with the executive producer. I said, ‘You know, if they’re 60 or over, I’m cutting them.’”

When an executive producer of the show warned Owens that he shouldn’t use the word “cut” and reassured him that all of the contestants would be “hot,” Owens said he’s used to using the term based on his time in the NFL.

Owens doubled down on his preference for younger women by saying, “They got to be fit because I’m staying in shape and work out and stuff. And I told them, ‘Try to stay away from the artificial hips and the wigs.’”
In an August interview with Glamour, Owens opened up about his controversial remarks.
“I apologized to the women on the show. When I first walked in, I addressed it. I apologized to them. I said, ‘It was unfair, insensitive. I want to earn it back. Just give me the chance,’” he said.
Owens also said he doesn’t care if the contestants have artificial hips or knees.
“People run marathons. I’m an attorney. I represent athletes with injuries, and most of them are football, hockey, a lot of them have artificial … so I know that people have them,” he said.
“Golden Bachelor” host Jesse Palmer asked Owens about his statements in a teaser video for the show’s season premiere, prompting Owens to say he is open to dating older women.
“I hope it doesn’t impact this journey,” he said in a confessional interview.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Reveals the Name His Agent Told Him to Use as a Young Actor
summary: Leonardo DiCaprio revealed on the "New Heights" podcast that an agent early in the actor's career suggested he use a different name.
story: Leonardo DiCaprio has stayed loyal to Leonardo DiCaprio.
While appearing on the Sept. 24 “New Heights” podcast with Jason Kelce and Travis Kelce, the Oscar winner revealed that, early in his career, an agent suggested he go by a different name

“I finally got an agent. They said, ‘Your name is too ethnic.’ I go, ‘What do you mean? It’s Leonardo DiCaprio?’ They go, ‘No, too ethnic. They’re never going to hire you. Your new name is Lenny Williams,’” he recalled alongside his “One Battle After Another” co-star Benicio del Toro.
The Kelce brothers burst out laughing when the “Wolf of Wall Street” star revealed the recommended name, while he continued to explain how the agent came up with it.
“I said, ‘What is Lenny?’” DiCaprio said. “I was 12,13. I said, ‘What is Lenny Williams?’ ‘We took your middle name and we made it — now you’re Lenny.'”
DiCaprio said his father wanted no part of the rebranded moniker.
“And my dad saw his photo, ripped it up, and he said, ‘Over my dead body,’” DiCaprio recalled, sparking more laughter.
Del Toro could definitely sympathize with being given a new name.
“I was told the same thing. ‘You’re Benny Del,’” he said.
“Benny Del?” DiCaprio and both Kelces asked.
“Lenny Williams, Benny Del,” DiCaprio said.
“This podcast would not be the same with Lenny Williams and Benny Del, I’ll tell you that right now,” Jason Kelce said.

title: Robert Irwin Confirms His Relationship Status: ‘My Life Is a Whirlwind’
summary: Does Robert Irwin have a girlfriend? He confirmed his relationship status and if he's single in an interview with E! News.
story: Robert Irwin has been delivering must-see performances so far on Season 34 of “Dancing With the Stars” with dance partner Witney Carson. But does the wildlife conservationist have a romantic partner outside of the ballroom?

As the 21-year-old continues to light up the dance floor with his impressive moves, some fans have become interested in his love life and wondered about his relationship status. Well, Robert Irwin decided to set the record straight when he spoke to E! News following the Sept. 23 episode of the dancing competition show.
He confirmed in the interview that he is single, according to the news outlet, before revealing what he is looking for in a relationship.
“I think more than anything else just genuine kindness,” Robert Irwin shared. “That’s so important, to surround yourself with people who are genuinely kind.”
He also said he wants to meet someone who can keep up with his adventurous lifestyle given his work as a conservationist and his ties to the Australia Zoo.
Robert Irwin added, “My life is a whirlwind, it’s an adventure. I would love to be able to share that with someone and to share those little moments.”
“I have a lot of great role models in the love department and a lot of people I look up to and go, ‘Wow, couples goals.’ So I want to find that,” he continued.
The “DWTS” contestant said he knows that he’ll find his perfect match when the time is right.
“It’s something you kind of can’t rush. It just has to happen and you’ve got to be open to that,” he said. “I know she’s out there and I look forward to it.”
Carson, who also chatted with E! News, said that she and Robert Irwin’s older sister, Bindi Irwin, are helping him out with his love life.
“Submit your applications via DM and I will forward them to Bindi. And then, then we will see about the American tourist,” she joked.
Robert Irwin replied, “I’ve got another protective older sister now.”

He is close to his real big sister, Bindi Irwin, who previously competed on and won “DWTS” Season 21 in 2015 with partner Derek Hough. So far this season, Bindi Irwin has been spotted in the ballroom cheering on her younger brother.

She has also been filming some of his rehearsals behind the scenes, including one with her adorable 4-year-old daughter Grace. Robert Irwin uploaded a video to Instagram that showed him practicing his dance moves with his niece.
After the two started giggling and jumping in a circle, Grace sweetly asked, “Did I do it?”
Robert Irwin proudly responded, “You did it! That’s it!”

title: Kelsea Ballerini Shares 3-Word Message After Chase Stokes Split
summary: Kelsea Ballerini is asking for some space following her breakup with Chase Stokes
story: Kelsea Ballerini is asking for some space following her breakup with Chase Stokes.
The “Love Me Like You Mean It” singer, 32, posted a video of herself on TikTok that she set to Ariana Grande's track "Shut Up."

In her brief video, Ballerini, who wears her hair pulled back into a ponytail, looks into the camera as she places her fingers on her temples in frustration while Grande sings, "Maybe you should shut up."

The country music star nods her head to the music before sipping from a can and then resting her head in one hand. The video ends with Ballerini pointing to viewers and then pointing her finger along to the music.
Ballerini wrote in her caption, "cc speculators, 'sources' and hidden cameras outside the hair salon."
Then she added a simple three-word message: "Let us be."
Ballerini's video comes a little more than a week after her rep confirmed to TODAY.com on Sept. 14 that she and Stokes had parted ways after dating for nearly three years.
The confirmation came two days after the "Outer Banks" star, who turned 33 on Sept. 16, celebrated Ballerini's 32nd birthday on Sept. 12.
“Although you keep saying you’re not excited for 32, id say I’m lookin forward to more of this,” Stokes captioned a carousel of pics of the couple he shared on Instagram.
“happy birthday my love,” he added along with a heart emoji.

Ballerini and Stokes became the subject of dating rumors in January 2023 after Stokes tagged the singer in an Instagram photo, shot from behind, that showed two people nuzzling close to each other while watching the College Football Playoff National Championship game.
Ballerini responded in the comments at the time, “Go vols.”
Stokes confirmed he and Ballerini were dating during an appearance on TODAY in March 2023. The pair made their red carpet debut at the CMT Music Awards the following month on April 2, 2023.
Following Ballerini’s TODAY performance on Aug. 11, 2023, she opened up to Sheinelle Jones about her romance with the actor.
“I’m so happy,” she said. “It’s nice to feel so supported and seen. He’s such a wonderful, wonderful human being.”

title: Alexandra Grant Addresses Reports She and Keanu Reeves Got Married
summary: Alexandra Grant addressed rumors that she and Keanu Reeves had gotten married. She denied the reports and called it "fake news" in an Instagram post.
story: Alexandra Grant responded to tabloid speculation that she and Keanu Reeves secretly married over the summer, clarifying that the pair had not tied the knot.
Grant shared a photo on Instagram on Wednesday, Sept. 24, of her kissing Reeves at Roden Crater in Arizona.

"This is a real photo," she wrote in the caption. "Not an engagement photo or an AI wedding announcement... simply a kiss! (Albeit maybe the moment right before or after it... given the slightly goofy expressions on our faces!)"
She explained the photo was snapped after Reeves and Gard Hollinger had interviewed James Turrell, the artist behind the land art at Roden Crater, for their series, “Visionaries.”

"I’m sharing it here to say thank you to everyone for the congratulations on our wedding. Except we didn’t get married," Grant said. "Good news is much needed these days, but it’s still fake news, so be careful out there! So, here’s a bit of real happiness!"
Unconfirmed reports surfaced earlier this week that the pair had gotten married, but Grant shot them down and confirmed the pair are still happily dating.
Grant and Reeves made their red carpet debut in 2019, when they attended the Los Angeles County Museum of Arts Art+Film Gala.
The pair have kept many of the details about their relationship private, but they've made red carpet appearances and have spoken about each other in interviews over the years.
Earlier this year, Reeves told "E! News" that he and Grant like to ride motorcycles together.
“Well Alexandra actually rode motorcycles and can ride,” Reeves told the outlet. “And then we have been on a couple of trips together on the motorcycle and we have enjoyed it.”
He added that the key to their relationship is “sharing, communicating, you know, supporting.”
Grant also spoke about their relationship in a 2023 interview with People.

“The good news about falling in love as an adult is that I had built my own career by the time that my relationship had begun,” she said. “I feel very confident in the relationship on the red carpet. I feel confident on it alone.”
She said Reeves "absolutely" had an impact on her art in the time they have been together.
“He’s such an inspiration to me,” she said. “He’s so creative, he’s so kind. He works so hard.”

title: Lauren Conrad Announces 'Laguna Beach' Reunion. What to Expect
summary: The cast of "Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County," including Lauren Conrad and Kristin Cavallari, will star in a reunion special for Roku Channel in 2026.
story: Nearly two decades after the finale of "Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County," the reality show's cast members are coming together again for a reunion special in 2026.
Lauren Conrad, one of the show's stars, posted a throwback photo from high school on Sept. 24 with seven other cast members, including Kristin Cavallari, Stephen Colletti, Trey Phillips and more.
"Let’s go back to the beginning… Reuniting the cast of Laguna Beach, coming to the Roku Channel in 2026," Conrad wrote in the caption of her Instagram post.
Roku announced the tentatively titled "Roku Presents: The Laguna Beach Reunion," a two-hour special that is set to air in 2026, in a news release.

The special is set to bring Conrad, Colletti, Cavallari, Lo Bosworth, Talan Torriero, Trey Phillips, Christina Shuller, Dieter Schmitz, Jessica Smith and Alex Hooser together, in honor of the show's 20th anniversary.

Roku said the reunion will mark the first time the original cast has been together since 2006, and will feature "untold behind-the-scenes stories, cast reactions to episodes of the original series, and a present-day return to where it all started — Laguna Beach."
Liz Gateley, the creator of "Laguna Beach," called reuniting the cast and producing the special 20-plus years after the premiere of the show "a dream."

“When I first pitched the show to my bosses at MTV, never in a million years did I think we would find such a perfect group of real friends,” Gateley said in a statement. “The show not only changed my life and the cast’s lives, but the series meant so much to a generation of fans who’ve been waiting for this.”
Gateley serves as an executive producer on the reunion special, alongside Conrad, Colletti and Cavallari.
The original show followed students at Laguna Beach High School in Orange County, California, and developed a cult following over the course of its three seasons.
The first season featured a love triangle between Conrad, Cavallari and Colletti, and the show ended with the senior students graduating and preparing to leave their hometown to go to college.
Roku did not provide an exact date for when the special is set to air, but the company said it will be available to stream for free on Roku devices or TVs, as well as online at TheRokuChannel.com.
The reunion can also be watched on iOS and Android devices, Amazon Fire TVs, Samsung TVs, Google TVs and other Android TV OS devices, according to Roku.

title: The Season 20 Finale of 'America's Got Talent' Airs Tonight. Here's How to Watch
summary: "America's Got Talent" will be crowning its new winner tonight. Learn how you can watch the Season 20 finale of the hit reality TV show.
story: Season 20 of "America's Got Talent" officially comes to an end tonight.

The winner of the new season will be crowned Wednesday, Sept. 24 on NBC and all four judges —  Sofia Vergara, Mel B., Howie Mandel and Simon Cowell — as well as host Terry Crews will be front and center to watch.

This season saw many talented contestants take the stage in hopes of walking away with the $1 million grand prize. "Vanderpump Rules" star Tom Sandoval auditioned to be on the program this season and got as far as the quarterfinals before he was axed from the show.

Though Sandoval wasn't able to make it to the end, other contestants did. Finalist Mama Duke wowed the judges with her witty raps and aerial performers Sirca Marea left everyone in awe when they soared through the air during one of the best performances of the season.

On Tuesday, Sept. 23, the 10 finalists gave it their all when they performed on the show and now the results will finally be revealed tonight. title: What Is the Rapture — and Why Is Everyone Talking About It?
summary: Why is TikTok talking about the rapture nonstop? A  Christian expert unpacks the rapture trend and what it means, plus what Joshua Mhlakela.
story: Anyone scrolling through TikTok this week may be wondering what's fueling chatter about the Rapture.

Videos with the hashtag #Rapture have gone viral in recent days, with some Christians stating Jesus Christ will return to Earth on Sept. 23 or 24 to collect true believers and bring them back to heaven with him. The event would mark the beginning of what some believers call the "end times" — or essentially, the end of human history.
On the flip side, others are creating their own videos satirizing the idea of the Rapture. In other words, it's been a lively week on social media. Read on to learn what #RaptureTok is all about.
What is the Rapture?
“Rapture is a theological belief within some strands of Christianity," Malynda Hale, activist and executive director of the progressive Christian nonprofit the New Evangelicals, tells TODAY.com.

"They believe that all the good Christians that have given their life over to Jesus and declare him as their Lord and Savior will be taken up. Those who are not saved will remain on Earth to endure prolonged suffering," she continues.

Some Christians, particularly evangelical Christians, believe the Bible predicts the rapture with the passage 1 Thessalonians 4:13-17. The passage describes a moment that believers are "caught up together ... in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air," per the King James Bible.
"Not all sectors of Christianity believe it," Hale says, but adds the reason it's "popular" with American evangelicals is because of the faith's focus on the afterlife.
"The afterlife is what matters. That's eternity. That's where we are immortal. Earth is just a small blip," she summarizes.
Why did people think the Rapture will happen on Sept. 23 and 24?
The dates this week were predicted by Joshua Mhlakela, a man from South Africa interviewed in a video posted to the Centtwinz TV YouTube channel.
"The time of The Rapture is at hand," Mhlakela said in the June 2025 video.
Mhlakela said that Jesus told him in a 2018 dream, “On the 23rd and the 24th of September, 2025, I will come to take my church.”

"He says to me — another thing that I forgot — is, 'In these two days, no one knows which days, or which hour, I will come," he said. Mhlakela was emphatic: "There are many dates out there, but the one that I'm telling you is the true one."

He also predicted that the end of the world would come after the Rapture, and that Jesus would rule on Earth in September 2032. In a livestream on Sept. 23, Mhlakela stood by his predictions, saying "everything in me knows" he would not be here on Sept. 25.

Hale isn't sure what about Mhlakela's predictions made them take off recently, but has a feeling it has to do with the dates' alignment Rosh Hashanah, or the Jewish New Year, which he pointed out in the initial prediction.
Still, Hale says, "I couldn't tell you what it was about him that has really made people kind of panic and believe that this is actually the one."
Have other dates for the Rapture been predicted?
The prophecy has since gone viral, with many sharing the video on social media — but, Hale points out, Mhlakela is hardly the first person to make such a prediction.
“This isn’t the first time that we’ve had Rapture theology come to the forefront,” Hale says.

There’s a long history of people predicting when the Rapture will happen, in fact. Countless people have shared their own predictions — on social media and otherwise — which are often based on visions, biblical interpretations and, sometimes, numerology.

Take Harold Camping, for example. In 2005, the American radio broadcaster and evangelist relied on his own interpretation of the book of Genesis to predict the Rapture was coming in 2011, according to NBC News' reporting at the time. (Camping had previously predicted the event would occur on three different dates in 1994.)

As for TikTok, as long as the platform has been active, believers have gathered to discuss the Rapture and other theological issues, even tackling the question of whether our pets get taken to heaven with us when the Rapture finally happens.
What are people saying about the Rapture on TikTok?
Some Christians on TikTok have shared videos filled with tips for other believers so they can be sure Jesus takes them home.
"The day of the lord is near, folks. Are you ready? Repent of your sins. Put your faith in Jesus," one user instructed viewers.

An account called christwillreturn has posted several videos of believers happily waiting for Jesus Christ's return. Another account called christianquotes89 posted a video of two men sharing calm words to non-believers who will be left behind during the Rapture.
“You’re probably wondering, where did the missing people go? What’s going on? I imagine you’re pretty afraid and looking for answers,” one of the men explains.
He goes on to say he and others believers are now "with Jesus."
Others are stressed by the idea of the Rapture. One TikToker who spent an hour on RaptureTok cried at the thought of only having a few more days with her children.
The "actual logistics" of the Rapture are "terrifying" to those who believe, Hale says. "But for them, it's really like, 'I finally get to go be with Jesus. That's eternal life.'"
As of Sept. 24, the Rapture hasn't happened. "I think it could leave people really disoriented," Hale says of the experience, adding that they could be "spiritually shaken."
"I think it's very concerning that people aren't thinking about the ramifications of pushing this theory because they're so convinced it's the truth."

title: Danielle Fishel Addresses Injury on 'DWTS' After Her Performance: 'Thank God for Body Makeup'
summary: Danielle Fishel performed a cha cha with her pro partner, Pasha Pashkov, on ABC's "Dancing With the Stars" Sept. 23 after suffering a hamstring tear.
story: Danielle Fishel performed a cha cha with her pro partner, Pasha Pashkov, during the second episode of the new "Dancing With the Stars" season on Tuesday, Sept. 23 — despite having a hamstring injury.
Fishel explained she was "pushing through the pain" while rehearsing her dance in the week leading up to the episode, which was "One-Hit Wonders Night."

"I have a hamstring tear that happened here at dance, and then I had a deep tissue massage, and it broke every blood vessel in the back of my leg," she said on the show, while showing a photo of the back of her calf, which was completely bruised.
"So, a cartwheel right into a split is a lot," she added. "I am pushing through the pain. It's a double elimination, and I am not going to let this injury stop me from dancing another week."
The former "Boy Meets World" star wore a neon pink dress as she danced to “Rhythm of the Night” by Corona alongside Pashkov.
The judges had positive feedback for the pair, with Bruno Tonioli saying Fishel had "the right amount of spice to get me going."
Carrie Ann Inaba said she really liked watching Fishel perform.

"There's a naturalness and an at-easeness to yourself when you dance," Inaba said. "There's a sophistication in the way you move. You're telling a story, even though it's cha cha, you're still telling the story. And I like that."
Derek Hough was asked to give his thoughts in just one word, and he responded, "Good."
While waiting for their scores, co-host Julianne Hough asked Fishel how her hamstring was feeling.
"The adrenaline is pumping, and thank God for body makeup!" she replied.

Fishel and Pashkov received scores of 7, 6 and 6, which will keep them on the show for another week, despite facing a double elimination. Cast members Corey Feldman and Baron Davis were sent home at the end of the night.
Fishel first mentioned that her hamstring had a "minor tear" on the Sept. 17 episode of her "DWTS" podcast, "Danielle With the Stars."

“Right before I went out for the live show, after having gone all out for five other runs for dress rehearsal and practice, my legs started really getting tight and I was like, ‘What am I going to do?’” she said. “And I kept trying to stretch a little bit, wasn’t really working. It was really cramping and then adrenaline just took over in the middle of the dance and I was able to do it.”
She said she had been icing her leg twice per night, plus taking Epsom salt baths and ibuprofen to help with the pain.
For Episode 3, Fishel and the remaining 11 dancers will be tackling "TikTok Night" on Sept. 30 as they dance to songs that have become popular from the app.
"Dancing With the Stars" airs on Tuesdays at 8 p.m. ET on ABC and Disney+, and can be streamed the next day on Hulu.

title: Firefighter’s Failed Blind Audition on ‘The Voice’ Ends With a Sweet Proposal
summary: A firefighter who didn't make it past the Blind Auditions on "The Voice" proposed to his girlfriend onstage during the show.
story: Never has someone who lost during a singing competition proven to be such a winner.

The Sept. 23 episode of “The Voice” featured Jacob Ryan Gustafson, 35, of Yucaipa, California, whose performance of Morgan Wallen’s “Spin You Around” during the Blind Auditions failed to get any of coaches to turn in their chairs. However, he got quite the consolation prize after he proposed to his girlfriend in front of the coaches and audience.
After his performance, Gustafson asked to bring his girlfriend, Jennifer, onto the stage with him.
“She is the reason why I’m here,” he said to the judges.
While she stood next to him, some of the coaches let him down gently.
“I got to be honest with you, Jacob,” Niall Horan said. “I was so close. If I could press it now, I would, but I’m so sorry, dude.”
Snoop Dogg expressed his appreciation for Gustafson being a firefighter and hinted maybe they could work on some music.
“I do have a record label, too, so we may be able to work out a few things,” he said.
Gustafson received the feedback and then turned to address his girlfriend.

“This life is a beautiful life, and I’m so blessed, and, even right now, if I could change anything, the only thing I’d change is your last name,” he said while looking at a teary Jennifer and reaching into his shirt pocket to take out a ring.
He then got down on one knee and popped the question.
“Will you marry me?” he asked while the coaches and audience hooted it up.
She immediately said, "Yes," prompting Horan, Snoop and fellow coaches Michael Bublé and Reba McEntire to join them onstage.
“Jake for the win, baby!” exclaimed Snoop.
“OK, so you won ‘The Voice,’” Bublé told Gustafson before giving him a hug.
“He’s the real winner,” Buble then told his new fiancée.
“Jacob shows that there are no losers on ‘The Voice,’” Bublé added. “What a beautiful moment. Yeah, nobody turned, but the person that he wanted most said yes.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: Final 'Wicked: For Good' Trailer Previews Glinda and Elphaba's Showdown
summary: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo return as Glinda and Elphaba in the final “Wicked: For Good” trailer. See the clip!
story: Cynthia Erivo’s Elphaba and Ariana Grande’s Glinda will meet again and face off in the forthcoming sequel, “Wicked: For Good,” and fans are getting a preview of their reunion in the final trailer for the movie.
After teasing the release on social media, the final trailer for “Wicked: For Good” aired exclusively on TODAY Sept. 24.

In the clip, a celebration is taking place when Elphaba is seen flying in the air and carving out the words, "Our wizard lies," in the clouds, as Glinda watches from below. Also, in a never-before-seen moment, Elphaba is seen confronting her old schoolmate and telling her she has "no real power."

Fans also get a preview of Dorothy's arrival in Oz. In one scene, she's seen standing in front of the Wizard with the Cowardly Lion, Tin Man and Scarecrow as the Wizard asks them to get Elphaba's broom for him so that he has proof she's dead.
The trailer is filled with moments of dispute — but also, it shows glimmers of friendship between Elphaba and Glinda.
"Think of what we could do together," Glinda tearfully tells Elphaba, who smiles back, at the end of the trailer.
The new trailer also features a snippet of Erivo singing “No Good Deed," and a preview of her and Grande belting along to “For Good.”
The new trailer for “Wicked: For Good” continues to build suspense for the upcoming film, which hits theaters on Nov. 21.
Online, fans said they can't wait for the new movie to come out.
"SO READY FOR THIS," one person commented on YouTube.
Another said, "I'm literally crying.
A third added, "I can't stop watching this."

Part two of the adaptation, based on the popular Broadway musical, follows the success of 2024’s “Wicked.” By the end of its theatrical run, “Wicked” brought in more than $700 million worldwide, per Deadline.
The fantasy flick landed Erivo an Academy Award nomination earlier this year for best actress in a leading role, and Grande a nomination for best supporting actress.
“Wicked” won two Oscars at the 97th Academy Awards for best achievement in production design for Nathan Crowley and Lee Sandales and best achievement in costume design for Paul Tazewell.
Even the most ardent fans of the original stage production will enjoy some surprises in the second “Wicked” film.

Composer Stephen Schwartz previously revealed to TODAY.com that “Wicked: For Good” will include two new songs penned for the movie.
